Posted By: Ironsharp (6/20/2011 12:13:12 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
He's capable of giving you [Brainstorm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brainstorm), an excellent spell in of itself, each and every single turn in a format where Brainstorm wasn't even printed.
  
   
4 Mana for a permanent that mimics Brainstorm for you each and every single turn is already amazing. However, this guy can also break top-decking, bounces creatures and is capable of..well...outright hosing your opponent's library.
  
   
It *sounds* a little too much, doesn't it?
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Just to point one thing out...  
JTMS's 0 ability is not just a free [Brainstorm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brainstorm), but it's ***better***! Brainstorm adds 3 cards to your hand and puts 2 on the top of your library; plus your hand loses a card: the played Brainstorm itself. No card advantage: you gain 3 cards and lose 3. With Jace you don't play any card, so you get 3 cards and lose 2. **ONE CARD ADVANTAGE! FOR FREE!**
posts.html:

Posted By: Endomarru (4/16/2012 1:44:04 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
You know what my worst memory of this guy is? Running into him in a limited match. I still have no idea why they printed him, if he could somehow counter spells he would be doing the job of just about every notable blue card on his own. He is on the cheaper side for planeswalkers. Why? He has a neutral ability that gains you card advantage. Why? His plus is not +1, but +2. Why? His last ability is closer to "you win" than any other planeswalker. It honestly feels like they just wanted to one-up every other planeswalker out there.   
  
I understand how [skullclamp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=skullclamp) happened. I suppose I understand [Trinisphere](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Trinisphere) slipping through. But what were they thinking here? How can anyone look at this card and not apply the strictest scrutiny before letting it through? This was slated as a mythic, they know added complexity is a balancing challenge, and he is the first four ability planeswalker. Every single red flag should have gone up when they saw this guy.
posts.html:
You know what my worst memory of this guy is? Running into him in a limited match. I still have no idea why they printed him, if he could somehow counter spells he would be doing the job of just about every notable blue card on his own. He is on the cheaper side for planeswalkers. Why? He has a neutral ability that gains you card advantage. Why? His plus is not +1, but +2. Why? His last ability is closer to "you win" than any other planeswalker. It honestly feels like they just wanted to one-up every other planeswalker out there.

I understand how skullclamp happened. I suppose I understand Trinisphere slipping through. But what were they thinking here? How can anyone look at this card and not apply the strictest scrutiny before letting it through? This was slated as a mythic, they know added complexity is a balancing challenge, and he is the first four ability planeswalker. Every single red flag should have gone up when they saw this guy.

Posted By: Travis44 (3/21/2012 1:54:58 PM)
Rating:

Ive beatin him so many times with causual decks, hes defitally not worth 100 bux.

@justicar- Brainstorm on a stick for an artifact is allot more powerfull then when its on a planeswalker. You just need to deal 3 damage to deal with that part, and if its on an artifact your forced to have artifact removal. And his +2 is allot beter then his 0 in my opinion. Disregarding that its 2 more damage for them to deal and the fact your getting that much closer to his ult, looking at there topdeck and deciding to trash it or not every turn is a big deal. His -1 is great but its not good for every situation.

@non1377 Think Archivist, but with Lightning Greaves. You can win with topdecks when they got 2 or 3 archivists out, ive done it. You can attack and nuke planeswalkers and hes squishy. If you get that 0 off (lightning bolt) then next turn u rock him. Then guess what? They basically just paid 100 bux or got really lucky to have a cmc 4 br... (see all)
